newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET SHORT BUT RATES STABLE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET SHORT BUT RATES STABLE.

text.p: Short-term trading rates on Zimbabwe's money market held steady at their previous levels on Friday despite an opening cash shortage in the system.
Dealers said the market opened short of Z$352 million but a few treasury bill maturities during the day had added liquidity and prompted a bit of market activity.
On Friday, treasury bills were being sold unchanged at 17.75 percent and NCD bills redeemable after 30, 60 and 90 days were also quoted stable in a 18 to 18.25 percentage range.
Bankers acceptance bills were between 18.25 and 18.50 percent while call money fluctuated between 16.50 and 17.50 percent.
